name: PCI DSS 4.0
description: Payment Card Industry Data Security Standard - A set of security standards designed to ensure that all companies that accept, process, store or transmit credit card information maintain a secure environment.

requirements.title: Install and Maintain Network Security Controls
requirements.description: Network security controls (NSCs), such as firewalls and other network security technologies, are network policy enforcement points that typically control network traffic between two or more logical or physical network segments.

children.title: Processes and mechanisms for installing and maintaining network security controls are defined and understood
children.description: Processes and mechanisms for installing and maintaining network security controls are defined and understood.

children.title: Security policies and operational procedures documented
children.description: All security policies and operational procedures that are identified in Requirement 1 are documented, kept up to date, in use, and known to all affected parties.

children.title: Roles and responsibilities documented and assigned
children.description: Roles and responsibilities for performing activities in Requirement 1 are documented, assigned, and understood.

children.title: Network security controls (NSCs) are configured and maintained
children.description: Network security controls are configured and maintained.

children.title: Configuration standards for NSCs defined and implemented
children.description: Configuration standards for NSC rulesets are defined, implemented, and maintained.

children.title: Changes to network connections reviewed and approved
children.description: All changes to network connections and to configurations of NSCs are approved and managed in accordance with the change control process.

children.title: Accurate network diagram maintained
children.description: An accurate network diagram(s) is maintained that shows all connections between the CDE and other networks.

children.title: Accurate data-flow diagram maintained
children.description: An accurate data-flow diagram(s) is maintained that meets specified criteria.

children.title: Allowed services, protocols, and ports identified
children.description: All services, protocols, and ports allowed are identified, approved, and have a defined business need.

children.title: Security features defined for insecure services
children.description: Security features are defined and implemented for all services, protocols, and ports that are in use and considered to be insecure.

children.title: NSC configurations reviewed at least every six months
children.description: Configurations of NSCs are reviewed at least once every six months to confirm they are relevant and effective.

children.title: Configuration files secured and synchronized
children.description: Configuration files for NSCs are secured from unauthorized access and kept consistent with active network configurations.

children.title: Network access to and from the cardholder data environment is restricted
children.description: Network access to and from the cardholder data environment is restricted.

children.title: Inbound traffic to CDE restricted
children.description: Inbound traffic to the CDE is restricted to only that which is necessary, and all other traffic is specifically denied.

children.title: Outbound traffic from CDE restricted
children.description: Outbound traffic from the CDE is restricted to only that which is necessary, and all other traffic is specifically denied.

children.title: NSCs installed between wireless networks and CDE
children.description: NSCs are installed between all wireless networks and the CDE, and configured to deny or control traffic.

children.title: Network connections between trusted and untrusted networks are controlled
children.description: Network connections between trusted and untrusted networks are controlled.

children.title: NSCs implemented between trusted and untrusted networks
children.description: NSCs are implemented between trusted and untrusted networks.

children.title: Inbound traffic from untrusted to trusted restricted
children.description: Inbound traffic from untrusted networks to trusted networks is restricted to communications with system components that are authorized to provide publicly accessible services.

children.title: Anti-spoofing measures implemented
children.description: Anti-spoofing measures are implemented to detect and block forged source IP addresses.

children.title: System components storing cardholder data not directly accessible
children.description: System components that store cardholder data are not directly accessible from untrusted networks.

children.title: Disclosure of internal IP addresses prevented
children.description: The disclosure of internal IP addresses and routing information is limited to only authorized parties.

children.title: Risks to the CDE from computing devices able to connect to both untrusted networks and the CDE are mitigated
children.description: Risks to the CDE from computing devices that are able to connect to both untrusted networks and the CDE are mitigated.

children.title: Security controls implemented for devices connecting to both
children.description: Security controls are implemented on any computing devices that connect to both untrusted networks and the CDE.

requirements.title: Apply Secure Configurations to All System Components
requirements.description: Malicious individuals often use default passwords and other vendor default settings to compromise systems. These passwords and settings are well known and easily determined.

children.title: Processes and mechanisms for applying secure configurations are defined and understood
children.description: Processes and mechanisms for applying secure configurations to all system components are defined and understood.

children.title: Security policies and operational procedures documented
children.description: All security policies and operational procedures that are identified in Requirement 2 are documented, kept up to date, in use, and known to all affected parties.

children.title: Roles and responsibilities documented and assigned
children.description: Roles and responsibilities for performing activities in Requirement 2 are documented, assigned, and understood.

children.title: System components are configured and managed securely
children.description: System components are configured and managed securely.

children.title: Configuration standards developed for all system components
children.description: Configuration standards are developed, implemented, and maintained for all system components.

children.title: Vendor default accounts managed
children.description: Vendor default accounts are managed as follows: if used, default password changed; if not used, accounts removed or disabled.

children.title: Primary functions requiring different security levels separated
children.description: Primary functions requiring different security levels are managed to separate components with different security requirements.

children.title: Only necessary services and protocols enabled
children.description: Only necessary services, protocols, daemons, and functions are enabled, and all unnecessary functionality is removed or disabled.

children.title: Insecure services and protocols secured
children.description: If any insecure services, protocols, or daemons are present, appropriate security features are documented and implemented.

children.title: System security parameters configured to prevent misuse
children.description: System security parameters are configured to prevent misuse.

children.title: Non-console administrative access encrypted
children.description: All non-console administrative access is encrypted using strong cryptography.

children.title: Wireless environments are configured and managed securely
children.description: Wireless environments are configured and managed securely.

children.title: Wireless vendor defaults changed for environments connected to CDE
children.description: For wireless environments connected to the CDE or transmitting account data, all wireless vendor defaults are changed at installation.

children.title: Wireless encryption keys changed appropriately
children.description: For wireless environments connected to the CDE or transmitting account data, wireless encryption keys are changed appropriately.

requirements.title: Protect Stored Account Data
requirements.description: Protection methods such as encryption, truncation, masking, and hashing are critical components of account data protection.

children.title: Processes and mechanisms for protecting stored account data are defined and understood
children.description: Processes and mechanisms for protecting stored account data are defined and understood.

children.title: Security policies and operational procedures documented
children.description: All security policies and operational procedures that are identified in Requirement 3 are documented, kept up to date, in use, and known to all affected parties.

children.title: Roles and responsibilities documented and assigned
children.description: Roles and responsibilities for performing activities in Requirement 3 are documented, assigned, and understood.

children.title: Storage of account data is kept to a minimum
children.description: Storage of account data is kept to a minimum.

children.title: Data retention and disposal policies implemented
children.description: Account data storage is kept to a minimum through implementation of data retention and disposal policies.

children.title: Sensitive authentication data (SAD) is not stored after authorization
children.description: Sensitive authentication data (SAD) is not stored after authorization.

children.title: SAD not retained after authorization
children.description: SAD is not retained after authorization, even if encrypted.

children.title: Full contents of track not stored after authorization
children.description: The full contents of any track are not retained upon completion of the authorization process.

children.title: Card verification code not stored after authorization
children.description: The card verification code is not retained upon completion of the authorization process.

children.title: PIN and PIN block not stored after authorization
children.description: The personal identification number (PIN) and the PIN block are not retained upon completion of the authorization process.

children.title: SAD stored electronically prior to authorization encrypted
children.description: SAD that is stored electronically prior to completion of authorization is encrypted using strong cryptography.

children.title: Additional requirement for issuers storing SAD
children.description: Additional requirement for issuers and companies that support issuing services and store sensitive authentication data.

children.title: Access to displays of full PAN and ability to copy cardholder data are restricted
children.description: Access to displays of full PAN and ability to copy cardholder data are restricted.

children.title: PAN masked when displayed
children.description: PAN is masked when displayed, such that only personnel with a legitimate business need can see more than the BIN and last four digits of the PAN.

children.title: Technical controls prevent copying/relocation when using remote-access
children.description: When using remote-access technologies, technical controls prevent copy and/or relocation of PAN.

children.title: Primary account number (PAN) is secured wherever it is stored
children.description: Primary account number (PAN) is secured wherever it is stored.

children.title: PAN rendered unreadable anywhere it is stored
children.description: PAN is rendered unreadable anywhere it is stored using one-way hashes, truncation, index tokens, or strong cryptography.

children.title: Hashes used to render PAN unreadable are keyed
children.description: Hashes used to render PAN unreadable are keyed cryptographic hashes of the entire PAN.

children.title: Disk-level encryption used only on removable media
children.description: If disk-level or partition-level encryption is used, it is only used to render PAN unreadable on removable electronic media.

children.title: Disk-level encryption managed independently
children.description: If disk-level or partition-level encryption is used, it is managed independently of the native operating system authentication.

children.title: Cryptographic keys used to protect stored account data are secured
children.description: Cryptographic keys used to protect stored account data are secured.

children.title: Key management procedures documented and implemented
children.description: Procedures are defined and implemented to protect cryptographic keys used to protect stored account data.

children.title: Additional requirement for service providers
children.description: A documented description of the cryptographic architecture includes the key strength and type of algorithms.

children.title: Secret and private keys stored securely
children.description: Secret and private keys used to encrypt/decrypt stored account data are stored in one of the specified forms.

children.title: Access to cleartext keys restricted
children.description: Access to cleartext cryptographic key components is restricted to the fewest number of custodians necessary.

children.title: Keys stored in fewest possible locations
children.description: Cryptographic keys are stored in the fewest possible locations.

children.title: Where cryptography is used, key management processes and procedures are defined and implemented
children.description: Where cryptography is used to protect stored account data, key management processes and procedures covering all aspects of the key lifecycle are defined and implemented.

children.title: Key generation procedures defined
children.description: Key-management policies and procedures are implemented to include generation of strong cryptographic keys.

children.title: Key distribution procedures defined
children.description: Key-management policies and procedures are implemented to include secure distribution of cryptographic keys.

children.title: Key storage procedures defined
children.description: Key-management policies and procedures are implemented to include secure storage of cryptographic keys.

children.title: Key changes at cryptoperiod end defined
children.description: Key management policies and procedures include changes to cryptographic keys at the end of their defined cryptoperiod.

children.title: Key retirement procedures defined
children.description: Key management policies and procedures include retirement or replacement of keys when integrity is weakened or suspected of being compromised.

children.title: Split knowledge and dual control for manual key operations
children.description: If manual clear-text cryptographic key-management operations are used, key-management policies and procedures include split knowledge and dual control.

children.title: Prevention of unauthorized key substitution
children.description: Key management policies and procedures include prevention of unauthorized substitution of cryptographic keys.

children.title: Key custodian acknowledgement of responsibilities
children.description: Key management policies and procedures include that cryptographic key custodians formally acknowledge they understand their responsibilities.

children.title: Additional requirement for service providers using cryptography
children.description: Additional requirement for service providers: documented description of cryptographic architecture includes all algorithms, protocols, and keys used.

requirements.title: Protect Cardholder Data with Strong Cryptography During Transmission
requirements.description: Sensitive information must be encrypted during transmission over networks that are easily accessed by malicious individuals.

children.title: Processes and mechanisms for protecting cardholder data during transmission are defined and understood
children.description: Processes and mechanisms for protecting cardholder data with strong cryptography during transmission over open, public networks are defined and understood.

children.title: Security policies and operational procedures documented
children.description: All security policies and operational procedures that are identified in Requirement 4 are documented, kept up to date, in use, and known to all affected parties.

children.title: Roles and responsibilities documented and assigned
children.description: Roles and responsibilities for performing activities in Requirement 4 are documented, assigned, and understood.

children.title: PAN is protected with strong cryptography during transmission
children.description: PAN is protected with strong cryptography during transmission.

children.title: Strong cryptography used during transmission over open networks
children.description: Strong cryptography and security protocols are implemented to safeguard PAN during transmission over open, public networks.

children.title: Inventory of trusted keys and certificates maintained
children.description: An inventory of the entity's trusted keys and certificates is maintained.

children.title: Wireless networks transmitting PAN use strong cryptography
children.description: Wireless networks transmitting PAN or connected to the CDE use industry best practices for strong cryptography.

children.title: PAN secured when sent via end-user messaging
children.description: PAN is secured with strong cryptography whenever it is sent via end-user messaging technologies.

requirements.title: Protect All Systems and Networks from Malicious Software
requirements.description: Malicious software (malware) is software or firmware designed to infiltrate or damage a computer system without the owner's knowledge or consent.

children.title: Processes and mechanisms for protecting systems from malicious software are defined and understood
children.description: Processes and mechanisms for protecting all systems and networks from malicious software are defined and understood.

children.title: Security policies and operational procedures documented
children.description: All security policies and operational procedures that are identified in Requirement 5 are documented, kept up to date, in use, and known to all affected parties.

children.title: Roles and responsibilities documented and assigned
children.description: Roles and responsibilities for performing activities in Requirement 5 are documented, assigned, and understood.

children.title: Malware is prevented or detected and addressed
children.description: Malware is prevented, or detected and addressed.

children.title: Anti-malware solution(s) deployed on all system components
children.description: An anti-malware solution(s) is deployed on all system components, except for those system components identified as not at risk from malware.

children.title: Anti-malware solution detects all known malware types
children.description: The deployed anti-malware solution(s) detects all known types of malware and removes, blocks, or contains all known types of malware.

children.title: System components not at risk for malware evaluated periodically
children.description: Any system components that are not at risk for malware are evaluated periodically to confirm that components continue to not require anti-malware protection.

children.title: Frequency of evaluations defined in targeted risk analysis
children.description: The frequency of periodic evaluations of system components not at risk is defined in the entity's targeted risk analysis.

children.title: Anti-malware mechanisms and processes are active, maintained, and monitored
children.description: Anti-malware mechanisms and processes are active, maintained, and monitored.

children.title: Anti-malware solution kept current via automatic updates
children.description: The anti-malware solution(s) is kept current via automatic updates.

children.title: Anti-malware solution performs periodic and active scans
children.description: The anti-malware solution(s) performs periodic scans and active or real-time scans, or performs continuous behavioral analysis of systems or processes.

children.title: Frequency of periodic malware scans defined in risk analysis
children.description: If periodic malware scans are performed, the frequency of scans is defined in the entity's targeted risk analysis.

children.title: Anti-malware solution for removable media
children.description: For removable electronic media, the anti-malware solution(s) performs automatic scans of removable media when inserted, connected, or logically mounted.

children.title: Audit logs for anti-malware enabled and retained
children.description: Audit logs for the anti-malware solution(s) are enabled and retained in accordance with Requirement 10.5.1.

children.title: Anti-malware cannot be disabled or altered by users
children.description: Anti-malware mechanisms cannot be disabled or altered by users, unless specifically documented and authorized by management on a case-by-case basis.

children.title: Anti-phishing mechanisms protect users against phishing attacks
children.description: Anti-phishing mechanisms protect users against phishing attacks.

children.title: Processes and mechanisms to detect and protect against phishing
children.description: Processes and automated mechanisms are in place to detect and protect personnel against phishing attacks.

requirements.title: Develop and Maintain Secure Systems and Software
requirements.description: Actors with bad intentions can use security vulnerabilities to gain privileged access to systems. Many of these vulnerabilities are fixed by vendor-provided security patches.

children.title: Processes and mechanisms for developing and maintaining secure systems are defined and understood
children.description: Processes and mechanisms for developing and maintaining secure systems and software are defined and understood.

children.title: Security policies and operational procedures documented
children.description: All security policies and operational procedures that are identified in Requirement 6 are documented, kept up to date, in use, and known to all affected parties.

children.title: Roles and responsibilities documented and assigned
children.description: Roles and responsibilities for performing activities in Requirement 6 are documented, assigned, and understood.

children.title: Bespoke and custom software are developed securely
children.description: Bespoke and custom software are developed securely.

children.title: Bespoke software developed securely
children.description: Bespoke and custom software are developed securely according to PCI DSS and industry standards.

children.title: Software development personnel trained in secure coding
children.description: Software development personnel working on bespoke and custom software are trained at least once every 12 months.

children.title: Bespoke software reviewed prior to release
children.description: Bespoke and custom software is reviewed prior to being released into production or to customers.

children.title: Manual code reviews by qualified individuals
children.description: If manual code reviews are performed, code is reviewed by individuals other than the originating author.

children.title: Software engineering techniques prevent common vulnerabilities
children.description: Software engineering techniques or other methods are defined and in use to prevent or mitigate common software attacks.

children.title: Security vulnerabilities are identified and addressed
children.description: Security vulnerabilities are identified and addressed.

children.title: Security vulnerabilities identified and managed
children.description: Security vulnerabilities are identified and managed according to a defined process.

children.title: Inventory of bespoke software maintained
children.description: An inventory of bespoke and custom software, and third-party software components incorporated into bespoke software, is maintained.

children.title: Critical security patches installed within one month
children.description: All system components are protected from known vulnerabilities by installing applicable security patches/updates.

children.title: Public-facing web applications are protected against attacks
children.description: Public-facing web applications are protected against attacks.

children.title: Public-facing web applications protected against attacks
children.description: For public-facing web applications, new threats and vulnerabilities are addressed on an ongoing basis.

children.title: Automated solution for web-based attacks deployed
children.description: For public-facing web applications, an automated technical solution is deployed that detects and prevents web-based attacks.

children.title: Payment page scripts managed
children.description: All payment page scripts that are loaded and executed in the consumer's browser are managed according to specified criteria.

children.title: Changes to all system components are managed securely
children.description: Changes to all system components are managed securely.

children.title: Change control procedures implemented
children.description: Changes to all system components in the production environment are made according to established procedures.

children.title: Significant changes documented
children.description: Upon completion of a significant change, all applicable PCI DSS requirements are confirmed to be in place.

children.title: Pre-production environments separated from production
children.description: Pre-production environments are separated from production environments and the separation is enforced with access controls.

children.title: Separation of duties between environments
children.description: Roles and functions are separated between production and pre-production environments.

children.title: Live PANs not used in pre-production
children.description: Live PANs are not used in pre-production environments, except where those environments are included in the CDE.

children.title: Test data removed before production
children.description: Test data and test accounts are removed from system components before production.

requirements.title: Restrict Access to System Components and Cardholder Data by Business Need to Know
requirements.description: Unauthorized individuals may gain access to critical data or systems due to ineffective access control rules and definitions.

children.title: Processes and mechanisms for restricting access are defined and understood
children.description: Processes and mechanisms for restricting access to system components and cardholder data by business need to know are defined and understood.

children.title: Security policies and operational procedures documented
children.description: All security policies and operational procedures that are identified in Requirement 7 are documented, kept up to date, in use, and known to all affected parties.

children.title: Roles and responsibilities documented and assigned
children.description: Roles and responsibilities for performing activities in Requirement 7 are documented, assigned, and understood.

children.title: Access to system components and data is appropriately defined and assigned
children.description: Access to system components and data is appropriately defined and assigned.

children.title: Access control model defined
children.description: An access control model is defined and includes granting access as needed.

children.title: Access assigned based on job classification
children.description: Access is assigned to users based on job classification and function.

children.title: Required privileges approved by authorized personnel
children.description: Required privileges are approved by authorized personnel.

children.title: User accounts and access privileges reviewed at least every 6 months
children.description: All user accounts and related access privileges, including third-party/vendor accounts, are reviewed at least every six months.

children.title: Application and system accounts access privileges assigned based on least privilege
children.description: All application and system accounts and related access privileges are assigned and managed according to least privileges.

children.title: Access reviewed periodically for application and system accounts
children.description: All access by application and system accounts and related access privileges are reviewed at defined frequency.

children.title: User access to query repositories restricted
children.description: User access to query repositories of stored cardholder data is restricted according to specified criteria.

children.title: Access to system components and data is managed via an access control system(s)
children.description: Access to system components and data is managed via an access control system(s).

children.title: Access control system(s) in place to restrict access
children.description: An access control system(s) is in place that restricts access based on a user's need to know.

children.title: Access control system(s) enforces permissions
children.description: The access control system(s) is configured to enforce permissions assigned to individuals, applications, and systems.

children.title: Access control system(s) set to deny all by default
children.description: The access control system(s) is set to 'deny all' by default.

requirements.title: Identify Users and Authenticate Access to System Components
requirements.description: Two fundamental principles of identifying and authenticating users are establishing the identity of an individual or process on a computer system, and proving or verifying the user associated with the identity.

children.title: Processes and mechanisms for identifying and authenticating access are defined and understood
children.description: Processes and mechanisms for identifying users and authenticating access to system components are defined and understood.

children.title: Security policies and operational procedures documented
children.description: All security policies and operational procedures that are identified in Requirement 8 are documented, kept up to date, in use, and known to all affected parties.

children.title: Roles and responsibilities documented and assigned
children.description: Roles and responsibilities for performing activities in Requirement 8 are documented, assigned, and understood.

children.title: User identification and related accounts are strictly managed throughout an account's lifecycle
children.description: User identification and related accounts for users and administrators are strictly managed throughout an account's lifecycle.

children.title: Unique ID assigned to each user
children.description: All users are assigned a unique ID before access to system components or cardholder data is allowed.

children.title: Group, shared, or generic accounts managed exceptionally
children.description: Group, shared, or generic accounts, or other shared authentication credentials are only used when necessary.

children.title: Additional requirement for service providers with remote access
children.description: Additional requirement for service providers: service providers with remote access to customer premises use unique authentication factors for each customer.

children.title: Addition, deletion, and modification of user IDs managed
children.description: Addition, deletion, and modification of user IDs, authentication factors, and other identifier objects are managed according to defined processes.

children.title: Access for terminated users immediately revoked
children.description: Access for terminated users is immediately revoked.

children.title: Inactive user accounts removed or disabled
children.description: Inactive user accounts are removed or disabled within 90 days of inactivity.

children.title: Third-party vendor accounts managed
children.description: Accounts used by third parties to access, support, or maintain system components via remote access are managed appropriately.

children.title: User sessions terminated after 15 minutes of inactivity
children.description: If a user session has been idle for more than 15 minutes, the user is required to re-authenticate.

children.title: Strong authentication for users and administrators is established and managed
children.description: Strong authentication for users and administrators is established and managed.

children.title: All user access authenticated with at least one factor
children.description: All user access to system components for users and administrators is authenticated via at least one authentication factor.

children.title: Strong cryptography used to render authentication factors unreadable
children.description: Strong cryptography is used to render all authentication factors unreadable during transmission and storage.

children.title: User identity verified before modifying authentication factors
children.description: User identity is verified before modifying any authentication factor.

children.title: Invalid authentication attempts limited
children.description: Invalid authentication attempts are limited by locking out the user ID after not more than 10 attempts.

children.title: Lockout duration at least 30 minutes or until administrator enables
children.description: If a user ID is locked out due to someone continuously trying to guess a password, the lockout duration is a minimum of 30 minutes or until the user's identity is confirmed.

children.title: Passwords/passphrases meet minimum length and complexity
children.description: If passwords/passphrases are used as authentication factors, they meet minimum length of 12 characters or complexity requirements.

children.title: Users not allowed to submit same password as previous four
children.description: Individuals are not allowed to submit a new password/passphrase that is the same as any of the last four passwords/passphrases used.

children.title: Authentication policies and procedures documented
children.description: Authentication policies and procedures are documented and communicated to all users.

children.title: Passwords/passphrases changed at least once every 90 days
children.description: If passwords/passphrases are used as the only authentication factor, they are changed at least once every 90 days, or access analyzed dynamically.

children.title: Additional requirement for service providers using passwords
children.description: Additional requirement for service providers: if passwords are the only authentication factor for customer user access, passwords are changed at least every 90 days, or analyzed dynamically.

children.title: Additional requirement for service providers for customer passwords
children.description: Additional requirement for service providers: if passwords are used as the only authentication factor for customer access, guidance is provided.

children.title: Physical and/or logical tokens can be used only once
children.description: Where authentication factors such as physical or logical security tokens, smart cards, or certificates are used, use of factors is assigned to an individual and can only be used once.

children.title: Multi-factor authentication (MFA) is implemented to secure access into the CDE
children.description: Multi-factor authentication (MFA) is implemented to secure access into the CDE.

children.title: MFA implemented for all non-console access into CDE
children.description: MFA is implemented for all non-console access into the CDE for personnel with administrative access.

children.title: MFA implemented for all access into CDE
children.description: MFA is implemented for all access into the CDE.

children.title: MFA implemented for remote network access
children.description: MFA is implemented for all remote network access originating from outside the entity's network that could access or impact the CDE.

children.title: Multi-factor authentication (MFA) systems are configured to prevent misuse
children.description: Multi-factor authentication (MFA) systems are configured to prevent misuse.

children.title: MFA systems implemented appropriately
children.description: MFA systems are implemented to ensure authentication factors are independent and not bypassable.

children.title: Use of application and system accounts is strictly managed
children.description: Use of application and system accounts and associated authentication factors is strictly managed.

children.title: System or application accounts managed appropriately
children.description: If accounts used by systems or applications can be used for interactive login, they are managed to prevent misuse.

children.title: Passwords/passphrases for system accounts not hard-coded
children.description: Passwords/passphrases for any application and system accounts that can be used for interactive login are not hard coded in scripts, configuration/property files, or bespoke code.

children.title: Passwords/passphrases for system accounts protected
children.description: Passwords/passphrases for any application and system accounts are protected against misuse.

requirements.title: Restrict Physical Access to Cardholder Data
requirements.description: Any physical access to cardholder data or systems that store, process, or transmit cardholder data provides the opportunity for individuals to access and/or remove systems or hardcopies containing cardholder data.

children.title: Processes and mechanisms for restricting physical access are defined and understood
children.description: Processes and mechanisms for restricting physical access to cardholder data are defined and understood.

children.title: Security policies and operational procedures documented
children.description: All security policies and operational procedures that are identified in Requirement 9 are documented, kept up to date, in use, and known to all affected parties.

children.title: Roles and responsibilities documented and assigned
children.description: Roles and responsibilities for performing activities in Requirement 9 are documented, assigned, and understood.

children.title: Physical access controls manage entry into facilities and systems containing cardholder data
children.description: Physical access controls manage entry into facilities and systems containing cardholder data.

children.title: Entry controls limit and monitor physical access to CDE
children.description: Appropriate facility entry controls are in place to limit and monitor physical access to systems in the CDE.

children.title: Individual physical access to sensitive areas monitored
children.description: Individual physical access to sensitive areas within the CDE is monitored with either video cameras or physical access control mechanisms.

children.title: Physical and/or logical controls restrict use of publicly accessible network jacks
children.description: Physical and/or logical controls are implemented to restrict use of publicly accessible network jacks within the facility.

children.title: Physical access to wireless access points and network gear restricted
children.description: Physical access to wireless access points, gateways, networking/communications hardware, and telecommunication lines within the facility is restricted.

children.title: Consoles in sensitive areas secured when not in use
children.description: Access to consoles in sensitive areas is restricted via locking when not in use.

children.title: Physical access for personnel and visitors is authorized and managed
children.description: Physical access for personnel and visitors is authorized and managed.

children.title: Procedures for authorizing and managing physical access implemented
children.description: Procedures are implemented for authorizing and managing physical access of personnel to the CDE.

children.title: Physical access to sensitive areas controlled for personnel
children.description: Physical access to sensitive areas within the CDE for personnel is controlled.

children.title: Procedures for managing visitor access implemented
children.description: Procedures are implemented for authorizing and managing visitor access to the CDE.

children.title: Visitor badges or identification surrendered
children.description: Visitor badges or identification are surrendered or deactivated before visitors leave the facility or at the date of expiration.

children.title: Visitor log maintained
children.description: A visitor log is used to maintain a physical record of visitor activity to the facility and computer rooms and data centers where cardholder data is stored or transmitted.

children.title: Media with cardholder data is securely stored, accessed, distributed, and destroyed
children.description: Media with cardholder data is securely stored, accessed, distributed, and destroyed.

children.title: All media with cardholder data physically secured
children.description: All media with cardholder data is physically secured.

children.title: Offline media backups stored in secure location
children.description: Offline media backups with cardholder data are stored in a secure location.

children.title: Security of offline media backup locations reviewed at least annually
children.description: The security of the offline media backup location(s) is reviewed at least once every 12 months.

children.title: All media with cardholder data classified
children.description: All media with cardholder data is classified in accordance with the sensitivity of the data.

children.title: Media with cardholder data sent via secured courier
children.description: Media with cardholder data sent outside the facility is secured by using a secured courier or other delivery method that can be accurately tracked.

children.title: Management approves all media moves
children.description: Management approves all media with cardholder data that is moved outside the facility.

children.title: Inventory logs of all electronic media with cardholder data maintained
children.description: Inventory logs of all electronic media with cardholder data are maintained.

children.title: Inventories of electronic media with cardholder data conducted at least annually
children.description: Inventories of electronic media with cardholder data are conducted at least once every 12 months.

children.title: Hard-copy materials with cardholder data destroyed
children.description: Hard-copy materials with cardholder data are destroyed when no longer needed for business or legal reasons.

children.title: Electronic media with cardholder data destroyed
children.description: Electronic media with cardholder data is destroyed when no longer needed for business or legal reasons.

children.title: Point of interaction (POI) devices are protected from tampering and unauthorized substitution
children.description: Point of interaction (POI) devices are protected from tampering and unauthorized substitution.

children.title: POI devices protected from tampering and substitution
children.description: POI devices that capture payment card data via direct physical interaction with the payment card form factor are protected from tampering and unauthorized substitution.

children.title: Up-to-date list of POI devices maintained
children.description: An up-to-date list of POI devices is maintained.

children.title: POI device surfaces periodically inspected
children.description: POI device surfaces are periodically inspected to detect tampering and unauthorized substitution.

children.title: Frequency of POI device inspections defined in risk analysis
children.description: The frequency of periodic POI device inspections and the type of inspections performed is defined in the entity's targeted risk analysis.

children.title: Training provided to personnel for POI device awareness
children.description: Training is provided for personnel in POI environments to be aware of attempted tampering or replacement of POI devices.

requirements.title: Log and Monitor All Access to System Components and Cardholder Data
requirements.description: Logging mechanisms and the ability to track user activities are critical in preventing, detecting, or minimizing the impact of a data compromise.

children.title: Processes and mechanisms for logging and monitoring are defined and understood
children.description: Processes and mechanisms for logging and monitoring all access to system components and cardholder data are defined and understood.

children.title: Security policies and operational procedures documented
children.description: All security policies and operational procedures that are identified in Requirement 10 are documented, kept up to date, in use, and known to all affected parties.

children.title: Roles and responsibilities documented and assigned
children.description: Roles and responsibilities for performing activities in Requirement 10 are documented, assigned, and understood.

children.title: Audit logs are implemented to support the detection of anomalies
children.description: Audit logs are implemented to support the detection of anomalies and suspicious activity, and the forensic analysis of events.

children.title: Audit logs enabled and active for all system components
children.description: Audit logs are enabled and active for all system components and cardholder data.

children.title: Audit logs capture all individual user access to cardholder data
children.description: Audit logs capture all individual user access to cardholder data.

children.title: Audit logs capture all actions taken with administrative privileges
children.description: Audit logs capture all actions taken by any individual with administrative access.

children.title: Audit logs capture all access to audit logs
children.description: Audit logs capture all access to all audit logs.

children.title: Audit logs capture all invalid logical access attempts
children.description: Audit logs capture all invalid logical access attempts.

children.title: Audit logs capture all changes to identification and authentication credentials
children.description: Audit logs capture all changes to identification and authentication credentials.

children.title: Audit logs capture initialization, stopping, or pausing of logs
children.description: Audit logs capture the following: initialization of the audit logs; stopping or pausing of the audit logs; creation and deletion of system-level objects.

children.title: Audit logs capture creation and deletion of system-level objects
children.description: Audit logs capture creation and deletion of system-level objects.

children.title: Audit logs record required information for each auditable event
children.description: Audit logs record the following details for each auditable event: user identification, type of event, date and time, success or failure indication, origination of event, and identity or name of affected data.

children.title: Audit logs are protected from destruction and unauthorized modifications
children.description: Audit logs are protected from destruction and unauthorized modifications.

children.title: Read access to audit logs limited to those with job-related need
children.description: Read access to audit logs files is limited to those with a job-related need.

children.title: Audit log files protected from unauthorized modifications
children.description: Audit log files are protected to prevent modifications by individuals.

children.title: Audit log files promptly backed up to secure central log server
children.description: Audit log files, including those for external-facing technologies, are promptly backed up to a secure, central, internal log server(s) or other media that is difficult to modify.

children.title: File integrity monitoring on audit logs
children.description: File integrity monitoring or change-detection mechanisms is used on audit logs to ensure that existing log data cannot be changed without generating alerts.

children.title: Audit logs are reviewed to identify anomalies or suspicious activity
children.description: Audit logs are reviewed to identify anomalies or suspicious activity.

children.title: Audit logs reviewed at least daily
children.description: The following audit logs are reviewed at least once daily: all security events; logs of all system components that store, process, or transmit CHD and/or SAD; logs of all critical system components; logs of all servers and system components that perform security functions.

children.title: Automated mechanisms used to perform audit log reviews
children.description: Automated mechanisms are used to perform audit log reviews.

children.title: Logs of other system components reviewed periodically
children.description: Logs of all other system components are reviewed periodically.

children.title: Frequency of periodic log reviews defined in risk analysis
children.description: The frequency of periodic log reviews for all other system components is defined in the entity's targeted risk analysis.

children.title: Exceptions and anomalies identified during review are addressed
children.description: Exceptions and anomalies identified during the review process are addressed.

children.title: Audit log history is retained and available for analysis
children.description: Audit log history is retained and available for analysis.

children.title: Audit log history retained for at least 12 months
children.description: Retain audit log history for at least 12 months, with at least the most recent three months immediately available for analysis.

children.title: Time-synchronization mechanisms support consistent time across all systems
children.description: Time-synchronization mechanisms support consistent time across all systems.

children.title: System clocks and time synchronized
children.description: System clocks and time are synchronized using time-synchronization technology.

children.title: Time data protected from unauthorized access
children.description: Time data is protected from unauthorized access.

children.title: Time settings received from industry-accepted time sources
children.description: Time settings are received from industry-accepted time sources.

children.title: Failures of critical security control systems are detected and addressed
children.description: Failures of critical security control systems are detected, reported, and responded to promptly.

children.title: Additional requirement for service providers for prompt detection of failures
children.description: Additional requirement for service providers only: Failures of critical security control systems are detected, alerted, and addressed promptly.

children.title: Failures of critical security control systems detected and addressed promptly
children.description: Failures of critical security control systems are detected, alerted, and addressed promptly, including but not limited to failure of: network security controls; IDS/IPS; FIM; anti-malware solutions; physical access controls; logical access controls; audit logging mechanisms; segmentation controls.

children.title: Failures of security control systems responded to promptly
children.description: Failures of any critical security controls systems are responded to promptly.

requirements.title: Test Security of Systems and Networks Regularly
requirements.description: Vulnerabilities are being discovered continually by malicious individuals and researchers, and being introduced by new software.

children.title: Processes and mechanisms for testing security are defined and understood
children.description: Processes and mechanisms for regularly testing security of systems and networks are defined and understood.

children.title: Security policies and operational procedures documented
children.description: All security policies and operational procedures that are identified in Requirement 11 are documented, kept up to date, in use, and known to all affected parties.

children.title: Roles and responsibilities documented and assigned
children.description: Roles and responsibilities for performing activities in Requirement 11 are documented, assigned, and understood.

children.title: Wireless access points are identified and monitored
children.description: Wireless access points are identified and monitored, and unauthorized wireless access points are addressed.

children.title: Authorized and unauthorized wireless access points managed
children.description: Authorized and unauthorized wireless access points are managed, including testing for unauthorized wireless access points at least quarterly.

children.title: Inventory of authorized wireless access points maintained
children.description: An inventory of authorized wireless access points is maintained, including a documented business justification.

children.title: External and internal vulnerabilities are regularly identified and addressed
children.description: External and internal vulnerabilities are regularly identified, prioritized, and addressed.

children.title: Internal vulnerability scans performed at least quarterly
children.description: Internal vulnerability scans are performed at least once every three months.

children.title: All other vulnerabilities managed based on risk
children.description: All other applicable vulnerabilities (those not ranked as high-risk or critical per the entity's vulnerability risk rankings) are managed.

children.title: Internal vulnerability scans performed via authenticated scanning
children.description: Internal vulnerability scans are performed via authenticated scanning.

children.title: Internal scans performed after significant changes
children.description: Internal vulnerability scans are performed after any significant change.

children.title: External vulnerability scans performed at least quarterly
children.description: External vulnerability scans are performed at least once every three months by a PCI SSC Approved Scanning Vendor (ASV).

children.title: External scans performed after significant changes
children.description: External vulnerability scans are performed after any significant change.

children.title: External and internal penetration testing is regularly performed
children.description: External and internal penetration testing is regularly performed, and exploitable vulnerabilities and security weaknesses are corrected.

children.title: Penetration testing methodology defined and documented
children.description: A penetration testing methodology is defined, documented, and implemented, and includes industry-accepted approaches.

children.title: Internal penetration testing performed at least annually
children.description: Internal penetration testing is performed at least once every 12 months and after significant changes.

children.title: External penetration testing performed at least annually
children.description: External penetration testing is performed at least once every 12 months and after significant changes.

children.title: Exploitable vulnerabilities corrected and testing repeated
children.description: Exploitable vulnerabilities and security weaknesses found during penetration testing are corrected and testing is repeated.

children.title: Segmentation testing performed at least every 12 months
children.description: If segmentation is used to isolate the CDE from other networks, penetration tests are performed on segmentation controls at least once every 12 months.

children.title: Additional requirement for service providers for segmentation testing
children.description: Additional requirement for service providers only: If segmentation is used to isolate the CDE, penetration tests are performed on segmentation controls at least once every six months.

children.title: Additional requirement for multi-tenant service providers
children.description: Additional requirement for multi-tenant service providers only: Multi-tenant service providers support their customers for external penetration testing.

children.title: Network intrusions and unexpected file changes are detected and responded to
children.description: Network intrusions and unexpected file changes are detected and responded to.

children.title: Intrusion-detection/prevention techniques used on network
children.description: Intrusion-detection and/or intrusion-prevention techniques are used to detect and/or prevent intrusions into the network.

children.title: IDS/IPS addresses covert malware communication
children.description: Intrusion-detection and/or intrusion-prevention techniques detect, alert on/prevent, and address covert malware communication channels.

children.title: Change-detection mechanism deployed on critical files
children.description: A change-detection mechanism (for example, file integrity monitoring tools) is deployed to alert personnel to unauthorized modification of critical system files, configuration files, or content files.

children.title: Unauthorized changes on payment pages are detected and responded to
children.description: Unauthorized changes on payment pages are detected and responded to.

children.title: Change-detection mechanism deployed for payment pages
children.description: A change- and tamper-detection mechanism is deployed to alert personnel to unauthorized modification of the HTTP headers and the contents of payment pages.

requirements.title: Support Information Security with Organizational Policies and Programs
requirements.description: A strong security policy sets the security tone for the whole entity and informs personnel what is expected of them.

children.title: A comprehensive information security policy is known and current
children.description: A comprehensive information security policy that governs and provides direction for protection of the entity's information assets is known and current.

children.title: Overall information security policy established
children.description: An overall information security policy is established, published, maintained, and disseminated to all relevant personnel.

children.title: Information security policy reviewed at least annually
children.description: The information security policy is reviewed at least once every 12 months and updated as needed.

children.title: Security policy clearly defines roles and responsibilities
children.description: The security policy clearly defines information security roles and responsibilities for all personnel.

children.title: Responsibility for information security assigned to CISO or equivalent
children.description: Responsibility for information security is formally assigned to a Chief Information Security Officer or other information security knowledgeable member of executive management.

children.title: Acceptable use policies are defined and implemented
children.description: Acceptable use policies for end-user technologies are defined and implemented.

children.title: Acceptable use policies documented and implemented
children.description: Acceptable use policies for end-user technologies are documented and implemented.

children.title: Risks to the cardholder data environment are formally identified, evaluated, and managed
children.description: Risks to the cardholder data environment are formally identified, evaluated, and managed.

children.title: Risk assessment performed annually and upon significant changes
children.description: Each PCI DSS requirement that provides flexibility for how frequently it is performed is supported by a targeted risk analysis.

children.title: Targeted risk analysis performed for each PCI DSS flexible requirement
children.description: A targeted risk analysis is performed for each PCI DSS requirement that the entity meets with the customized approach.

children.title: Cryptographic cipher suites and protocols documented and reviewed
children.description: Cryptographic cipher suites and protocols in use are documented and reviewed at least once every 12 months.

children.title: Hardware and software technologies reviewed at least annually
children.description: Hardware and software technologies in use are reviewed at least once every 12 months.

children.title: PCI DSS compliance is managed
children.description: PCI DSS compliance is managed.

children.title: Additional requirement for service providers for executive responsibility
children.description: Additional requirement for service providers only: Responsibility is established by executive management for the protection of cardholder data and a PCI DSS compliance program.

children.title: Additional requirement for service providers for quarterly reviews
children.description: Additional requirement for service providers only: Reviews are performed at least once every three months to confirm that personnel are performing their tasks in accordance with all security policies and operational procedures.

children.title: Additional requirement for service providers for documentation of reviews
children.description: Additional requirement for service providers only: Reviews conducted in accordance with Requirement 12.4.2 are documented to include results and remediation actions.

children.title: PCI DSS scope is documented and validated
children.description: PCI DSS scope is documented and validated.

children.title: Inventory of system components in scope maintained
children.description: An inventory of system components that are in scope for PCI DSS, including a description of function/use, is maintained and kept current.

children.title: PCI DSS scope documented and confirmed at least annually
children.description: PCI DSS scope is documented and confirmed by the entity at least once every 12 months and upon significant change to the in-scope environment.

children.title: Additional requirement for service providers for scope confirmation every 6 months
children.description: Additional requirement for service providers only: PCI DSS scope is documented and confirmed by the entity at least once every six months and upon significant change.

children.title: Additional requirement for service providers for impact of changes on PCI DSS scope
children.description: Additional requirement for service providers only: Significant changes to organizational structure result in a documented review of the impact to PCI DSS scope and applicability of controls.

children.title: Security awareness education is an ongoing activity
children.description: Security awareness education is an ongoing activity.

children.title: Formal security awareness program implemented
children.description: A formal security awareness program is implemented to make all personnel aware of the cardholder data security policy and procedures.

children.title: Security awareness program reviewed at least annually
children.description: The security awareness program is reviewed at least once every 12 months and updated as needed.

children.title: Personnel receive security awareness training
children.description: Personnel receive security awareness training upon hire and at least once every 12 months.

children.title: Security awareness training includes awareness of threats
children.description: Security awareness training includes awareness of threats and vulnerabilities that could impact the security of the CDE.

children.title: Security awareness training includes acceptable use of end-user technologies
children.description: Security awareness training includes awareness of acceptable use of end-user technologies.

children.title: Personnel are screened to reduce risks from insider threats
children.description: Personnel are screened to reduce risks from insider threats.

children.title: Potential personnel screened prior to hire
children.description: Potential personnel who will have access to the CDE are screened, within the constraints of local laws, prior to hire.

children.title: Risk to information assets associated with third-party service providers is managed
children.description: Risk to information assets associated with third-party service provider (TPSP) relationships is managed.

children.title: List of TPSPs with which account data is shared maintained
children.description: A list of all third-party service providers with which account data is shared or that could affect the security of account data is maintained.

children.title: Written agreements with TPSPs maintained
children.description: Written agreements with TPSPs are maintained.

children.title: Established process for engaging TPSPs includes due diligence
children.description: An established process is implemented for engaging TPSPs, including proper due diligence prior to engagement.

children.title: Program to monitor TPSPs' PCI DSS compliance status
children.description: A program is implemented to monitor TPSPs' PCI DSS compliance status at least once every 12 months.

children.title: Information maintained about which PCI DSS requirements managed by each TPSP
children.description: Information is maintained about which PCI DSS requirements are managed by each TPSP, which are managed by the entity, and any that are shared.

children.title: Third-party service providers support their customers' PCI DSS compliance
children.description: Third-party service providers (TPSPs) support their customers' PCI DSS compliance.

children.title: Additional requirement for TPSPs to acknowledge responsibility
children.description: Additional requirement for TPSPs only: TPSPs acknowledge in writing to customers that they are responsible for the security of account data the TPSP possesses or otherwise stores, processes, or transmits on behalf of the customer.

children.title: Additional requirement for TPSPs to support customer requests for information
children.description: Additional requirement for TPSPs only: TPSPs support their customers' requests for information to meet requirements 12.8.4 and 12.8.5.

children.title: Suspected and confirmed security incidents are responded to immediately
children.description: Suspected and confirmed security incidents that could impact the CDE are responded to immediately.

children.title: Incident response plan exists and is available
children.description: An incident response plan exists and is ready to be activated in the event of a suspected or confirmed security incident.

children.title: Incident response plan reviewed and tested at least annually
children.description: At least once every 12 months, the security incident response plan is reviewed and the content is updated as needed.

children.title: Specific personnel designated for 24/7 response
children.description: Specific personnel are designated to be available on a 24/7 basis to respond to suspected or confirmed security incidents.

children.title: Personnel responsible for responding to incidents appropriately trained
children.description: Personnel responsible for responding to suspected and confirmed security incidents are appropriately and periodically trained.

children.title: Frequency of training for incident response personnel defined
children.description: The frequency of periodic training for incident response personnel is defined in the entity's targeted risk analysis.

children.title: Incident response plan includes monitoring and responding to alerts
children.description: The security incident response plan includes monitoring and responding to alerts from security monitoring systems.

children.title: Incident response plan modified and evolved based on lessons learned
children.description: The security incident response plan is modified and evolved according to lessons learned and to incorporate industry developments.

children.title: Incident response procedures in place for unexpected PAN discovery
children.description: Incident response procedures are in place, to be initiated upon the detection of stored PAN anywhere it is not expected.
